title: How to Get Good in Renaissance Kingdoms

steps.headline: Check your mail when you first log-on.
steps.description: There should be a welcoming message to send you on your way.

steps.headline: Go to the market, by clicking on the market button more or less in the middle of the screen.
Buy one bread at the market.
steps.description: It should not cost more than six to seven pounds and you should not be prepared to pay more - remember, you need to save money to level up!

steps.headline: Eat the bread by going to your inventory and clicking on the little hand next to the bread that says "use".
steps.description: Now you will not be hungry anymore, as indicated by the apple in the top right of your screen. Do this every day.

steps.headline: Click on the "Out of Town" link on your link-bar on the left.
Click on the "Work" tab at the top of the screen.
Click on the icon you see to work at the mine for 8 pounds.
steps.description: It should be a bar with a pick-axe, or something similar. The mine is the best place for a newcomer to work, because you get 8 pounds that day and another 8 pounds on Sundays. If you work in the mine seven days a week, you can make 112 pounds. Enough to eat every day and to level up within the week.

steps.headline: Ask other players for Reputation Points.
steps.description: You can only receive three from other players at level 0. The other two you will need to get from working at the church.

steps.headline: Work at the Church for two days to gain two RPs.
Click on the Bailiwick button on your town map, once you have saved up 90 pounds and have 5 Reputation Points.
Click on the "Meet the Count's First Secretary" link.
steps.description: You will asked which type of field you want to buy for 90 pounds. The best field for a newbie is a vegetable field.

steps.headline: Congratulations!
steps.description: Once you buy your field, you are level 1. Now you can harvest your field, eat what you grow and sell the rest on the market. Continue to work in the mine when you can, so that you can afford to eat better meals in the taverns, to get your strength, charisma and intelligence points up.

text: Check your mail when you first log-on. There should be a welcoming message to send you on your way. Go to the market, by clicking on the market button more or less in the middle of the screen.  Buy one bread at the market. It should not cost more than six to seven pounds and you should not be prepared to pay more - remember, you need to save money to level up! Eat the bread by going to your inventory and clicking on the little hand next to the bread that says "use". Now you will not be hungry anymore, as indicated by the apple in the top right of your screen. Do this every day. Click on the "Out of Town" link on your link-bar on the left.  Click on the "Work" tab at the top of the screen.  Click on the icon you see to work at the mine for 8 pounds. It should be a bar with a pick-axe, or something similar. The mine is the best place for a newcomer to work, because you get 8 pounds that day and another 8 pounds on Sundays. If you work in the mine seven days a week, you can make 112 pounds. Enough to eat every day and to level up within the week. Ask other players for Reputation Points. You can only receive three from other players at level 0. The other two you will need to get from working at the church. Work at the Church for two days to gain two RPs.  Click on the Bailiwick button on your town map, once you have saved up 90 pounds and have 5 Reputation Points.  Click on the "Meet the Count's First Secretary" link. You will asked which type of field you want to buy for 90 pounds. The best field for a newbie is a vegetable field. Congratulations! Once you buy your field, you are level 1. Now you can harvest your field, eat what you grow and sell the rest on the market. Continue to work in the mine when you can, so that you can afford to eat better meals in the taverns, to get your strength, charisma and intelligence points up.
